awards.title: EOS Award - nominee - finalist
awards.description: EOS Magazine awards the best entry from the exact sciences or beta sciences with a thesis prize.

awards.title: Paul Donnors Engineering Prize
awards.description: The criteria for assessing all applications are practicality, originality, personal contribution, presentation and content & structure of the accompanying texts. Eight master's theses were selected for the finals. A Jury of ie-net members followed a defence of my master's theses and those of the other finalists at the university at the beginning of October. The Paul Donners Engineer Award winner was announced during the annual Limburg Engineers Event.

awards.title: IAC - Hans von Muldau Team Award for the Best Team Project
awards.description:
The Deutsche Gesellschaft fur Luft-und Raumfahrt (DGLR) presented the OSCAR-QUBE team with the Hans von Muldau Team Award for our paper: 
“OSCAR-QUBE: Integrated Diamond-Based Quantum Magnetic Field Sensor for Space Applications” – International Astronautical Congress (IAC) 2021, Dubai, UAE.

projects.title: Forecasting temperature with SARIMAX in python
projects.description:
Assignment 1 of the Smart Systems course lectured by Vincent Claes @ PXL University College. 

The goal of this assignment is to write firmware for the SimpleLink Wi-Fi CC3200 LaunchPad that collects and uploads the data it gathers from its temperature sensor. Using the collected data the goal is to make a prediction of temperatures. These prediction are made in Jupyter Notebook using the Python scripting language. A flask server backend is provided on an heroku server together with an heroku PostgreSQL.

Big thanks to my co-creator who has the project on his github (See the link).

projects.title: IOT Raspberry Pi weather station project

Build a mini weather station which's data can be uploaded to a database and visualized in a web browser.
Included; Temperature, Humidity, Pressure and CPU temperature.

For more info follow the link to my GitHub repo.

authors.headline: Engineering and Operation support for REXUS BEXUS @ ESA 🌌 | MSc Ing. Industrial Engineer 📚 | '20-'21 ESA "Orbit Your Thesis!" participant with OSCAR-QUBE 🚀 |

profile_positions.description:
Programme and engineering coordination for multiple campaigns on the following vehicles supported by ESA Academy:
• REXUS: Sounding rockets at the Esrange Space Center of SSC
• BEXUS Stratospheric balloons at the Esrange Space Center of SSC
• Fly A Rocket! - This programme offers the chance to university students early in their studies to learn about rocketry and to have the chance to launch their very own rocket from Andøya Space. In partnership with Andøya Space Education and the Norwegian Space Agency (Norsk Romsenter)

Within these projects the coordination of the hands-on activities and experiments is crucial. Working closely with the facility operators and with specialists, I helped to select experiments proposed by university student teams and followed up on their projects throughout their lifecycle (concept, design, development, testing, experiment campaign, data analysis).

Responsibilities and developed skills:
• Reviewing technical documentation, project assessment and follow-up from start till finish
• Supporting final integration and testing of experiments
• Supporting launch campaigns and flight vehicle/ experiment-flight vehicle interface knowledge
• Operations introduction on multiple flight vehicles

The REXUS/BEXUS Programme is run in collaboration with partners from DLR (German Aerospace Center), SNSA (Swedish National Space Agency), SSC (Swedish Space Corporation), ZARM (Center of Applied Space Technology and Microgravity), MORABA (Mobile Rocket Base) and EuroLaunch as well as with European Universities.
profile_positions.title: Engineering and Operation support for Rocket and Balloon Experiments

profile_positions.description:
Programme and engineering coordination for multiple campaigns on the following platforms supported by ESA Academy:
• Spin Your Thesis! - Experiments are made in hypergravity (up to 20 g) in the Large Diameter Centrifuge of ESTEC (Noordwijk, Netherlands)
• Drop Your Thesis! - Experiments are conducted in microgravity, in the ZARM drop tower (Bremen, Germany)
• Fly Your Thesis! - Microgravity is recreated during parabolic flights operated by Novespace (Bordeaux, France)
• Orbit Your Thesis! - The payload is sent to the International Space Station and integrated into the Ice Cubes Facility of Space Application Services, (Zaventem, Belgium)

Within these projects the coordination of the hands-on activities and experiments for university students related to microgravity and hypergravity platforms is crucial. Working closely with the facility operators and with specialists, I helped to select experiments proposed by university student teams and followed up on their projects throughout their lifecycle (concept, design, development, testing, experiment campaign, data analysis).

Core responsibilities: 
• be involved in the preparation, coordination and delivery of training workshops
• follow up experiment projects throughout design, development and testing
• help organise progress meetings and project reviews to verify the experiments' readiness
• assist with logistical arrangements for the experiment campaigns
• contribute to the successful execution of the campaigns
• ensure proper follow-up of the analysis of the experiment results

Aside from this, I helped the programme to transition to its current form, the ESA Academy Expereiments programme.
profile_positions.title: Engineering and Operation support for gravity-related experiments

profile_positions.description:
Supporting the team where needed in finishing up on the operations of the project in the ISS.
Supporting the team where needed in preparations for the YPSAT payload; OSCAR-QUBE+
profile_positions.title: System Support Engineer

profile_positions.description: OSCAR-QUBE is a student project that aims to develop a diamond-based quantum magnetometer. The goal is to prove the viability of this technology in extreme conditions by launching it into space. As a team, we got selected to participate in the OYT (Orbit Your thesis) program organized by ESA education, which gives us the chance to fly our newly developed quantum magnetometer on board the ISS for four months. For my Master's thesis, I acquired an internship with OSCAR after my extracurricular involvement during my bridging program. My responsibility is mainly focused on developing the laser subsystem and the testing and characterization of its performance in pulsed and continuous-wave operation.
profile_positions.title: Master Thesis Project: Laser subsystem for pulsed PDMR measurement techniques

profile_positions.description:
Extracurricular involvement during my bridging program at UHasselt/KULeuven.

During this time I helped the team to downsize from the full size optical table to the first PCB prototypes. The design, testing and validation of these PCB's was crucial to advance our project and our mission to the ISS.

The OSCAR-QUBE project is the part of the OSCAR project series. With this new chapter, we got shortlisted, and eventually, we got selected to fly our project to the ISS. This year was mostly comprised of preparations to get ready to launch the project by August 2021.
profile_positions.title: Engineer Intern

profile_positions.description: From capturing the most fun moments at parties to making portraits.
profile_positions.title: Photographer

profile_positions.description:
For my bachelor thesis, I did an internship at the BDE (Biomedical Device Engineering) Research Group at the IMO (Institute for material research). This is a research center at UHasselt with enormous knowledge in the field of materials science. IMO has an integrated and intensive collaboration with IMOMEC (Institute for Materials Research in MicroElectronics), the department of IMEC (Interuniversity Micro Electronics Center, Leuven) on the university campus in Diepenbeek.

For my research, I worked on a way to perform viscosity measurements based on an MCU (EPS32 based), a self-designed PCB, and filtration paper that is commercially available. The aim was to obtain a cheaper and smaller device that could deliver reproducible results.
profile_positions.title: Bachelor Thesis: Reproducibility of paper-based viscosity measurements

profile_positions.description:
To finish my bachelor's degree I chose to do my internship at Yangzhou University in Yangzhou, Jiangsu, China. The assignment revolved around updating the PCB of a PV/Battery/Grid System. The thesis that is coupled to this has the following title; Efficient PCB production by thermal simulation. In this thesis, I make clear what the benefits are to simulating the thermals of a PCB for the entire production process.

PV = Photo Voltaïc
profile_positions.title: Bachelor thesis internship at Yangzhou University

profile_positions.description:
During a two week project in Jimma University in Jimma, Ethiopia we worked in groups of local and foreign students to tackle problems that arose in the local community. These groups tackled problems such as; waste disposal, education, education for the visual and or hearing impaired students, work environments for shoe-shiners,...

This experience was amazing both in a professional setting and as a person.
profile_positions.title: South Intensive Project Jimma Ethiopia
